definition.name: AWS Lambda Deploy
definition.description: Deploying Lambda code to an existing function
definition.author: Bo-Yi Wu

inputs.name: aws_region
inputs.description: AWS Region

inputs.name: aws_access_key_id
inputs.description: AWS ACCESS KEY

inputs.name: aws_secret_access_key
inputs.description: AWS SECRET KEY

inputs.name: aws_session_token
inputs.description: AWS Session token

inputs.name: aws_profile
inputs.description: AWS profile

inputs.name: function_name
inputs.description: AWS lambda function name

inputs.name: s3_bucket
inputs.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

inputs.name: s3_key
inputs.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

inputs.name: s3_object_version
inputs.description: AWS lambda s3 object version

inputs.name: zip_file
inputs.description: AWS lambda zip file

inputs.name: source
inputs.description: zip file list

inputs.name: dry_run
inputs.description: Set to true to validate the request parameters and access permissions without modifying the function code.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Show debug message after upload the lambda successfully.

inputs.name: publish
inputs.description: Set to true to publish a new version of the function after updating the code.

inputs.name: reversion_id
inputs.description: Only update the function if the revision ID matches the ID that is specified.

inputs.name: memory_size
inputs.description: The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.description: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.

inputs.name: handler
inputs.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function.

inputs.name: role
inputs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function execution role.

inputs.name: runtime
inputs.description: The identifier of the function runtime.

inputs.name: environment
inputs.description: Lambda Environment variables.

inputs.name: layers
inputs.description: A list of function layers, to add to the function execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version

inputs.name: image_uri
inputs.description: URI of a container image in the Amazon ECR registry.

inputs.name: subnets
inputs.description: Select the VPC subnets for Lambda to use to set up your VPC configuration.

inputs.name: securitygroups
inputs.description: Choose the VPC security groups for Lambda to use to set up your VPC configuration.

inputs.name: description
inputs.description: A description of the function.

inputs.name: tracing_mode
inputs.description: Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with AWS X-Ray.

inputs.name: max_attempts
inputs.description: the maximum number of times the waiter should attempt to check the resource for the target state

inputs.name: architectures
inputs.description: The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Architecture is a string array with one of the valid values. The default architecture value is x86_64.

inputs.name: ipv6_dual_stack
inputs.description: Enables or disables dual-stack IPv6 support in the VPC configuration

evidence.reasoning: The action is primarily focused on deploying code to AWS Lambda, which falls under the Deployment category. It also requires AWS credentials for authentication, linking it to both Authentication and Infrastructure categories.
